content: The Fault in Our Stars explores the idea of love in the face of mortality through the main characters, Hazel and Gus, who are both terminally ill with cancer. Despite their terminal illnesses, they fall in love with each other and pursue a relationship knowing that they will not have unlimited time together. The novel shows how love becomes more significant and valuable when faced with the inevitability of death, as it provides a source of comfort, hope, and joy in the face of mortality. The novel also depicts how love can motivate and inspire people to live life to the fullest, while simultaneously coming to terms with their own mortality. Overall, The Fault in Our Stars portrays the ways in which love and the awareness of mortality are intertwined and how love can offer a redemptive and transformative power in the face of death.
